text: just tightening up the tarp a bit here I
think sometimes I don't show knots
enough so I want to show this one to you
this one is when you've got a long line
and you're going around a pole or tree
or something like that and you're coming
back and now it's like well where do I
tie this off you tie it off at the tree
sometimes that's a real pain because the
tree is full of you know scratchy pokey
branches everywhere and you can't really
reach in so you can get around it but
going in and tying off there's a pain so
if you've got a long rope and you come
back out on the rope itself you can tie
like right here and believe it or not
it'll be secure just go over and then
I'm going to go over one two three more
times so I went over and I went one two
three like that through the last time
you instead of just looping through that
one line you go all the way around poke
down through okay and pull forward now
when you do it what I like to do is take
my fingers just make sure all those
little loops I made look nice and round
so they got a real nice look to them
okay so now I can actually pull this
line and slide this knot to make this
nice and taut okay and that holds it
like that I like to then lock it off to
do that real real simple you know you
normal square knot just make a square
knot like one one knot at the end
that's all just went out at the end and
then down and that actually locks it in
place I can constantly move this and
tighten it if I need to there you go
there's a good survival not for you
right there
